page.title: 07THE KENNELS
page.content: THE KENNELS, continued from page 6 Mr. and Mrs. Crane started the kennels themselves 13 years ago. The areas that they take dogs in from are Gloucester and the surrounding district. They have only refused to take a dog in once and that was because it was old and very vicious. They have one part-time worker who is on a Youth Traing Scheme. Every morning after breakfast the dogs are exercised in the paddock, one at a time. While the dogs are exercising, their kennel is cleaned. Dogs generally stay at the kennels for a period of 14-21 days while their owners are on holiday abroad. They leave the dogs behind to avoid having to leave them in quarantine when they come back from abroad. This is to try to keep the disease Rabies out of the country.
